text:
I have been here now five times, I live in Colorado, so every time I am in Vegas, I make it a point to eat here, usually with family / friends or a group.

I arrived just minutes after they opened on a Saturday, I was very hungry, I was seated quickly and ordered a variety of options including hummus, falafel and chicken swharma, grape leaves and so on. It arrived quickly and was obviously freshly made. That cured my hunger, and the waitress, (from Michigan) was very helpful and friendly.

I have never had a bad experience here, I cannot explain why some people have, I find prices fair and worth it.
If you have kids don't go to this place the owner is so stupid rude no wonder the place was empty . I have 1 star for the chef and the waiter they were amazing and very helpful

My husband and I had lunch here yesterday as we were trying to utilize one of the last Entertainment book coupons we had for 2014 (yes, it's ok to be thrifty). We both tried a lunch plate-the chicken kabob and the lamb one (9.95 & 10.95 respectively for the lunch price). The waitress was nice although with only 1 other table there, we waited quite a while for water. If you've eaten Mediterranean food before, you know that kabob plates come with rice, vegetables or cucumber salad and, obviously, a kabob. NOT SO at Ali Baba. We both recd a small plate with plain (AND I MEAN PLAIN) basamati rice (no spices at all) with a few slivers of onion and a half a tomato off to the side. The 4 pieces of chicken were so dry, I was washing it down with water after every bite because it was getting stuck in my throat (the whole meal...super dry). It wast most obviously a leftover from the night before even though we were there at about 12:30pm. The lamb wasn't as dry but, no taste...at all (again...no spices). I was super disappointed....all I could think was-at least we're not paying full price for this 'food'. As I've mentioned, there was another table and (because I like to eavesdrop), I overheard them ask for a side of yogurt and heard the waitress say 'yes, I'll bring you a little bowl" and even made the gesture with her hand as to how big the bowl was so the guy knew how much he was getting. Thinking that the yogurt could make this less than stellar meal a little less dry, my husband asked for some only to be advised that the only yogurt they had was included with an app on the menu. I'm a great eavesdropper, the other guy DID NOT order the app. The only thing I could think was 'that's what we get for using a coupon'. We paid and left.....and will never return. Not because of the waitress....because food drives me-and this was not worth the half price we paid.

We love Mediterranean food so, if you're so inclined to love it too...do yourself a favor and drive a mile or so more South on Eastern and end up at Yalla's - you won't be disappointed!
This is a restaurant with good food but it has super expensive food, I would recommend it if your willing to pay more.

Considering this was my first time in a Lebanese restaurant I was not sure what to expect. The overall experience was worth the visit. From the live music to the hookahs at every table it is as authentic as you are going to find. The food was good and plentiful. The staff was friendly and very attentive. It's worth the visit and the experience but come when you have some time. Plan on at least 3 hours to soak it all in.

They microwaved their bread so long that it was hard like a rock when it cooled downed.  I sent back two appetizers because they were microwaved and just disgusting.  Don't order anything is pastry puff.  The lamb was soooo tough it was not edible.  Waitress argued this is how they aways made it, and she ate it every day.  Too bad for her!  Don't waste your money on this overpriced, poor quality food.  And when they say it includes pine nuts in the dish, don't believe it unless you have a microscope and are willing to search for it!!!  So so bad, ugh, $60 for 3 apps and 1 entree... what a waste!!!!

Our first time trying this cuisine. Delicious. Middle Eastern spices are so interesting!  Great food, atmosphere and very friendly service. Spinach pies are hot and delicious with a bright lemony flavor. Be sure to save room for dessert. Although we missed it, live music and belly dancers on the weekends. We will definitely be back.

Delicious. And reasonable.
Great options for vegetarians and meat lovers alike. I had an assortment of appetizers - happy hour ! - and it was all very good.

An excellent experience all the way around. The place was buzzing on Saturday evening. Very vibrant, lively setting. Fabulous food. Amazing atmosphere (live music and belly dancing). Beautiful people, all of whom were very friendly. Will definitely return.

The service was great but the food sucks, not fresh and the place was empty wen I came in! The chicken shwarma was disappointing, not fresh, and very salty. The pita bread came out before the flavorless garlic sauce. You're not even given rice or anything else with your meal. Just keep looking like zanko chicken in California or make your own. They need improvements to create a buzz.
It was awful service, the food took forever to get to the table. It was very dry, I couldn't eat it. Never going back there again.

I went to this restaurant with my man for dinner we had kissed when we sat down at out table in front of these 4 young men smoking a hookah and there was 1 other party of adults that had just walked in after we did. The greeting we got after 10 minutes was sorry guys this is a family owned restaurant there might be kids around.... Wtf! First of all no kids were around in that restaurant second its okay to smoke hookah but not kiss your spouse over a dinner table and I am talking about smooches nothing really r rated . so never going back to this place again .
beware of all the stores in the colonade shopping center as the entire area is severely infested with rats
One star is too much for this place! I hated it. We went in the afternoon the waitress was a jerk and the food was like I was swallowing garlic

The ambiance is nice; the waiter was very polite and friendly. I ordered a mixed grill combo consisting of kafta, lamb, and chicken kababs. It comes with rice and onion slices. Chicken was OK, kafta was better, and the lamb was the best. Not the best I've ever had, though. 

The pita breads are served fresh and hot; they bake them when you order them  and they taste very good.

I certainly recommend this place to those who seek mediterranean food and kababs.

I was there for the first time and after ordering food and drinks I was hit with an overcharged Bill!!! Simply unacceptable! I will never go there again and would not recommend this place to anyone. No one should have such an end to a night in vegas.

Good food,
Best mekanek in town... Authentic and good environment especially saturday night

Ok. I am torn to give this place 2 stars. 
Food wise it should be 5 stars, tasty, fresh and delicious food. HOWEVER, the service is terrible. The waiters are not engaging, the wait time for everything is crazy long even when the place is empty. I come here often because the food is great, but the wait is always an issue. It takes a long time for them to NOTICE you when you arrive. You order wine and it takes a long time for them to bring the bottle to the table and the same happens with the food and hookah. It actually takes a long time for you to get your check too. I sincerely don't understand. I think with training this place can be an amazing spot with great chances to be one of the best on its sector.

Delicious food, excellent service, nice atmosphere. And they finally taught me how to mix the middle eastern oregano and dip the pita bread in it. The falafel was excellent! The hummus was very tasty. The baklalva was the best I've had in Vegas yet, better than most places in NYC.We heard there is Belly Dancing on Friday, Saturday night...

Okay... Not sure how this place gets such a high rating, because we had dinner here, and the food was not very good. We specifically ordered our salmon plate and steak kabob medium and juicy, and got them both well done. The steak was like dry leather, and neither had any flavor.  The pita basket (which we had to ask for) was ice cold and tough, and came dry with nothing on the side. Unless you count a slice of half-grilled tomato and some rice, there were no vegetables on either plate. Left $50 lighter in the wallet, and unsatisfied.  Won't be back.
Honestly i love arab men and this place is life because middle easterns are sexy as fuck. The men i mean. The women look like shemales. But you guys. Honestly. Good job. At being sexy.

SCAM SCAM SCAM!!!

VISITORS ... RESIDENTS ... ALL of you PEOPLE ... BEEEE AWARE OF THIS ONE ... THEY WILL TRY TO CHARGE U TWICE FOR TIPS!!! What kind of people do that really!!!

I went to this one because one of the nearby restaurants (Middle Eastern) was also closed for renovation.

Let me begin my review with this: 

1. They charge you automatically 18% a gratitude tip of the overall amount! It is CLEARLY written in the bill as 18% Gratuity (mine was around 7 dollars). 

2. Then the server will bring you another bill to sign with BIG BLANK SPACE With the WORD TIP!!!! AND NOTE: the 18% are already included and they simply want you to add more!! BUT without your attention!!

Whhhhat ... This is the first time everrrrrrrrrrrr in my life I find someone with the courage the do such stupid cheating!!! Do you want me to tip you again!! Do you think people are really stupid not to notice that!!!

I'm a person who tip generously ... I like to tip even when the server is not that good because we all face hard days so don't expect a perfect service each single time you sit in a restaurant. Waitress and servers are human and face greater pressure than us who just came to enjoy a meal and leave. But what happened in this cuisine is really unprecedented! To have the courage to decide the amount of tip I wanna put is mean and malicious, but to send me another bill with tip space (with the total amount already including 18% tip) is PURE THEFT!


To the owner: 

1) I hate when you decide in behalf of me how much I should tip your employees. The server was good (may be because the restaurant was really empty), but still this don't give you the right to decide for me!!

2) Your shish taooq is really not tasty! $17 for a small plate of kebob is really OVERPRICED ... I'm a Middle Eastern who live in LA, California and even in fancy places which are located in the most expensive locations like West Hollywood, Beverly Hills, SFV (not in the border of Las Vegas like yours) don't charge $17 for a small  Middle Eastern Plate! I know how much it cost to prepare a high quality plate (I'm into the food business), and yours are totally and ridiculously overpriced. You will have (2 to 4) dollars revenue in a $10 plate (the average cost for a kebab plate made with good and fresh ingredient, not to mention it  includes labor cost and rent as well!). Yours, based on my experience, cost less than 6 (100% sure providing I don't know how much is the rent in the border lines of Las Vegas): Thus, it is completely ridicules to ask for $17 to your plate ...

3) I'm seriously disguised by your trick! I dare you to replay with reasonable answer to this incident without the words: I'm sorry, it was a mistake!!

What an Irony: Ali Baba in the Arabic culture was a guy who used to steal people's money, but hey at least we heard he was givin' em' away to the poor!!!

My boyfriend and I came here for Valentine's Day. We were actually there the day before, so the place was totally empty. We ordered a bunch of plates to share -- falafel, grapeleaves, hummus and bread, fatoosh, tons of meat, and dessert later on. The food was delicious and I thought the prices were reasonable. The dessert was a bit strange. It was some kind of pink shredded wheat-type stuff with melted cheese on the inside, and then you poured this sweet stuff all over it. Definitely not our taste (way too sweet), but we loved everything else. The restaurant was clean and our waiter was friendly.
By far the best restaurant in town with great live music on Saturday nights and excellent food, prices are very reasonable and the staff provide superb customer service
I love Ali Baba. The food is so tasty fresh and healthy with wonderful service and a cozy atmosphere. The mezza plates are a must and then venture on from there. Ask for George; he's amazing!

This place starts with a nice atmosphere and continues with great service. Our server was helpful and friendly. This was my first time eating Lebanese food, and I thought the shwarma was just okay. However, my friend is familiar with shwarma and thought it was the best he'd ever eaten, including those he ate in Middle Eastern nations. We also had the quail appetizer (two grilled quails over fries); it was amazing! The spices they used were delicious! I did find out quails are very small birds. Next time I will go at night to check out the live entertainment.

Its ok. Not reall impressive if you are middleeastern. Food is cold and service is disorganized. They can do better. Environment is a bit unique with live middle eastern music. The waiter was very nice and polite.

So much that passes for Falafel is kind of cold and hard and greasy. THIS Falafel is SO GOOD. Crisp & hot on the outside, fluffy inside. Really perfect.

More expensive than I prefer, but clearly labeled $$, the decor is fairly plush, authentic, very comfortable, a place one could linger with friends for hours. And the existence of hookah means that's more likely. 

I got the appetizer for two, which is a spendy $35. But it was full of excellent, varied, well prepared and delicious choices. Babaganouj. Dolmas. Hommos. Tabouli salad. Yogurt dip. Spinach pies. Cheese pies. Fresh bread. And those Falafel! 

After filling up, I took more than 1/2 home in ToGo containers (which they prepared for me in the back) to my son waiting at home. We'll enjoy this double appetizer for the next couple days, until mommy and the boys get home. 

This was a very good experience for me grabbing a quick bite after work. I'd very much like to come back with my whole family of six, although I suspect the bill will be well close to $200.

Ordered the chicken shawarma with hummus and garlic sauce and fries. Got plenty of food for $12 bucks only. It is about 10 minutes from the Las Vegas strip. Should check it out once. There was only one waiter so took a while to place an order and get the food.

This place is a rip off. The worst experience we have had in Vegas. They are very dishonest and do not provide any customer service. We were group of 10. We went there last night. This was was not our first time being there. The waiter got $100 and promised us to we could drink our own Alcohol and we could open as many bottles as we wanted. When ordering the food we knew it was not going to be more than $350 by looking at the prices. Plus, we were there with the same group last year and we spent $350 on food and Opening our own Alcohol beverages. We were expecting a check of around $400-450. The waiter came up to us and gave us a $1010bill. We told the owner the whole story but he did not want to work with us. We ended up paying the amount but we will never ever go to that place again. I recommend everyone not to go to that place. They are ripping off people and do not care about customer service. Worst place to go in Vegas. Don't even waist your money and time on going there because you won't be treated well.
Great hookah. I've also ordered some appetizers which were just all right. Service was great though !!!

Went here the other night and service was HORRIBLE! At first they refused to seat us inside even though there were plenty of open seats. After a long wait they did seat us, but then (after 30 minutes with only water) never took our order, even after we asked several times. We left and will never return. Way to make your guests feel extremely unwanted and uncomfortable Ali Baba. Go to Pasha if you want good food and service.

I'm always on the look out for a great middle eastern restaurant and this place totally delivered. 

The food was so great. When my family goes out for middle eastern food we always order family style. It's the ONLY way you should order when eating middle eastern food. Get one of everything that looks good and go in a big group. We had the hummus, baba ghanoush, kibbeh, grape leaves, falafel, tabbouleh, knafe, kebabs and a lot of other stuff. All of it was amazing. The kibbeh was moist and the meat had amazing flavor. The baba ghanoush was awesome, and it's really hard to find a super well done baba ghanoush. 

The grape leaves were also fantastic. Now, people who have tried grape leaves before, most likely you have tried Greek dolmas. These are not those. These are the middle eastern grape leaves. They are hot and come with meat and rice in them. They are, in my opinion, much better. But be warned, they might now be what you expect. 

I could go on in detail about how awesome everything we had was, but I'm going to skip to the knafe. 

It is SUPER hard to find good knafe. Theirs was great! First of all, they make it with shredded filo dough, sometimes they are made with a more grainy pancake like dough. But the shredded filo is the way to go always with knafe. The cheese was gooey and warm and the rose water syrup was outstanding. Very sweet, so ease up on how much you dump on top of yours.

There was also live Arabic music and it was really good! If you're brave, there is a dance floor. I had not had enough to drink tonight. Maybe next time...

And can I just rave about the service for a second? They were so accommodating and friendly. It was like someone was having you over for dinner in their home. They were hospitable and kind. The food came out very quickly and our server was very good at explaining and answering any questions we had. When we paid our bill and were leaving, he walked us out and said goodbye. It was truly and wonderful experience. 

I am so happy I now have a place I can go to in Vegas for great Arabic food and feel like I'm home with my family.
Best Lebanese food I've had in my life. Sam the manager is most friendly guy I've met before. Restaurant is clean and most important great food.

My husband and I just ate here... It was very good! He had the lamb chops and I had the beef shwarma, we got an appetizer (I forget the name of it now) as well. The appetizer was very good, basically seasoned ground beef in a dough then fried. Dinner was served shortly after, mine was amazing! I got the tabbouleh instead of the veggies and the tabbouleh mixed with the beef and a bit of hummus and olive oil... perfecto ;-) haha... Hubby enjoyed his dish as well...even the rice that came with his was yummy. We wrapped it up with backlava and pistachio Lebanese cookies. 

Everything was really good.... wasn't busy at all (we were the only ones at the time) but I see from other reviews it's busy on the weekends. Our server and the other staff were very friendly and nice. 4 stars because the price was a little on the expensive side... not too bad, my plate was $18 but I did get a big portion. 

We'll back!!

P.S. Baklava was to die for. Best I've had! Usually it's to sweet and sticky, this was delicious.
Definitely not a good place to eat with friends, especially on a budget. There are cheaper and better Lebanese food out there. You are paying for over priced food and lack of service.

The worst Arabic restaurant I ever dined into. My lamb shank was not done at all it felt like I am eating tires instead of lamb. Also, the tomato paste was TOO much to the point the food was tasting sweet instead of salty and there was no taste of spices at all. Also, the kenafeh I ordered was TOO old and it felt like nylon in my mouth. Bad food for very high price. STRONGLY not recommended. For the money you'll pay in it, you would find a lot tastier and cheaper places.

Last time I was here was 2 years ago, That time everything was great. This time, not so much. I went in with a friend. She ordered the Beef Shish Kabob. The meat was over cooked, very dry. She told our server when she asked for some sauce , he did not offer to make her a new plate. When we brought up again after she tried it with a sauce, then he offered. I had the Rotisserie Chicken, the chicken was good. however the potatoes and carrots that came with it were mostly under-cooked and hard. I was disappointed.

Came in on Friday at 4:30. The place was empty except one table of 4. Got shawarma for the first time and I wasn't disappointed. The herbs and spices made the dish tasty and filling. The place itself did not feel very clean and it smelled cloying sweet and musky, probably from hookah use.

First time here. 
Was really impressed. 
This was for a military retirement party and for her daughters graduation. 
Nice atmosphere and very enjoyable. 
Belly dancers!!!!
Our party had bought a whole lamb. I don't eat very much lamb but it was very good.

I will try this place again.

Lebanese Food...Don't Mind If I Do

There are some foods in this world that make me wonder, how did I ever grow up without this?? Lebanese food is one these! 

My friend Nicole and I were going out for lunch the other day and decided to try Ali Baba, a Lebanese restaurant. Upon arrival the waitress was outside and greeted us with a friendly hello. As we entered the restaurant I couldn't help but take in all the decor...the Tiffany inspired chandlers, the paintings on the wall (which turned out to be wall paper), the pillars, the long tables, and the dance floor with a stage that was set up to play bands. There was only one group of dinners in the restaurant and there wasn't any music playing, which was a little unsettling. But we decided to go forth and see what the experience could bring us!

The menu was quit detailed, so if it was your first time eating Lebanese food, you'd know what you would be getting into. It all looked so good to me! We ended up ordering some hummus, tabbouleh, a shawarma sandwich and a chicken taouk sandwich. We decided that we would share everything! The hummus was so tasty, just like it should be. So creamy and smooth with a buttery taste. The tabbouleh was amazing with the finely minced parsley, diced tomatoes, onions, cracked wheat, mint, extra virgin olive oil, and lemon juice! Very yummy...I could eat it every day! The shawarma sandwich was good. This sandwich is usually marinated in yogurt and spices over night, although, I'm not sure what this places uses as the marinade. It did come with tahini sauce, garlic, lemon juice, seasoned onions, sliced tomato and pickles. The chicken taouk sandwich wasn't as good but I think that's because of the garlic sauce they put in it. If you dare to eat this sandwich, make sure you don't have to be up-close and personal with someone! The chicken was char-grilled served with garlic sauce, tomatoes and pickles. Both sandwiches came with french fries, which I thought was a little odd. I would have preferred a small side of hummus or babganoush instead.

Over all, we stuffed ourselves and had leftovers! I will go back when the craving for hummus is calling! But I would wait till later in the day for when the band and belly dancers show up!  I can't wait to see them perform in person! 

http://inapplesworld.blogspot.com/
Dont't pay with credi/ATMt card. They will change the tip line. I think it was the manager that did it too.

FALSE ADVERTISING BEWARE!!!
BAD SERVICE!!!
FOOD IS BELOW AVERAGE!!!
OVER PRICED!!!

We tried to order the special that was sent to our address. First I was told it's over at 7, I told him I read it and it said 8. Waiter advised it was too close to 8 (it was 10 to 8). 

To the owner of the restaurant ITS NOT ABOUT THE MONEY BUT DONT LIE TO GET ME THERE AND TRY TO HUSTLE ME. I paid full price and left a 20% tip even though service was bad not one smile. 

Too many restaurant in this area I definitely won't be back!

This place is super expensive. Today I went there with friend and we paid $180 

$25 was only for tip that was on the recieve mandatory

Kebab mix plate is $70 there is couple beef and chicken and normal size  meze is $70 

I never see anything like this in my life

Went here last night with my wife and another couple.  We were absolutely the only people inside the restaurant, while what looked like the owner/manager and two friends were smoking hookah outside.  
    After waiting about 3-4 minutes we were greeted at the table as we had come a few minutes behind our friends who had already ordered drinks.  The owner/manager I mentioned earlier was our waiter because he didn't seem to be wearing any kind of serving uniform.  
     After we ordered our food about 10 minutes went by at which point a man who was clearly the cook (wearing apron) came up to us, hurriedly, to take our order.  We told him we had already ordered, and he asked who took the order and we pointed to the manager coming through the door with ingredients bought at a nearby market.  He ran up to him then they both ran back to the kitchen together. OK so they ran out of ingredients, and clearly the cook had no idea anyone was inside the restaurant or had ordered for those first 10 minutes.  
     About 20 minutes later we got our food, which was OK, definitely not anything great.  The chicken shawarma looked like it had been thrown together rather quickly and not really fully cooked (probably because they were trying to rush after having to go to the market to get ingredients).  
     I had a beer but my wife had ordered a Mojito.  BIG mistake... it was absolutely terrible, did not taste anything even remotely close to a Mojito.  It was so bad even I wouldn't finish it just for the buzz.
     Then we waited for our check.....and waited....and waited..... and waited.  The manager walked past us towards his little office near the front of the restaurant twice, without saying a word to us.  Then he went outside for about 5 minutes.... then came back and went to the kitchen... then finally came over and asked us if we needed anything.   Uhhhh yea the check, we've been sitting here for 13-15 minutes.  
     So finally the check came... and WOW! Each beer (12 oz.) was $5.  The previously mentioned absolutely terrible Mojito was a whopping $9.  The other dishes were $13-$19.  The Chicken Shawarma was $16 but definitely not worth more than $12.  So everything was definitely overpriced.  
     I would come back here if I had no other options, but if there is another Lebanese place open within about 15 miles I would go there rather than here.....
     Freakin $9 "Mojito"???

Okay, I have no reference in much Lebanese or Middle Eastern food other than a container of Hummus and pita chips I bought from Costco on their demo days  and some kebabs from those outdoor food fairs.  I came here for  a lunch special for one of those lunch birthday during work kinda thing about 2 years ago. The lunch special was buffet style and I tried everything in the buffet line.  The staff  was friendly and everything tasted different, which is a good thing.  I even tried to make some of these dishes myself using a quick Google search...fail.  Anyway, I have to try some other place to compare. Yes, it was two years ago but my palette remembers.  All in all, I  would go back again.

I ordered just a bunch of appetizers. Hummus, Baba Ghanooj, Kibe Nayyi, fried kibe, yogurt, black tea and a hookah at the end. Everything was great. I would only tone down the cumin just a bit in the kibe nayyi. Service was great, and it was fast. A place to visit every time I'm in Vegas. Maybe I'll plan my next visit so I'm here over a Weekend to enjoy the live entertainment.

Was desperate to find a good Middle Eastern / Lebanese place in Vegas and one day we stumbled upon Ali Baba after trying a few others. Nice place - some authentic dishes that are worth the trip, and an authentic and non-Vegas seeming interior. Cool place.

The food at this place is amazing , hookah was smooth and you have to try the house wine.

I'll be back here soon. The new waitress there is awesome ! 

Great place to get great food, hookah and drinks before 5pm

We live around the corner and drive by this place all the time, but have never eaten here. So tonight on a impulse we decided to give it a try and so happy we did! In short we ordered the kabob combo and it was fantastic, great flavor and cooked right. The grape leafs were phenomenal as well. Even though we were full, we went for dessert anyway. I highly recommend the rice pudding but ask for extra sauce :)

Excellent food, very friendly, very kind servers, I was very turned off with some of the reviews, I was here a while back when I came to town, and I had another heat experience, that what I came back again, and thank god I did, excellent delicious food and I will definitely come again this week while I am in town, try it for your self and judge, you will be pleasantly surprised

The food is not consistent. Times the food is amazing and other times not very good. I am  Lebanese and know well how the food should taste. This place is also very expensive for a local place. What was most concerning was the last time I was there I ordered a traditional Lebanese dish that is raw meat incorporated with bulgar. When I took the first bite I knew the meat was bad. This dish is only made with the freshest of meat. When I called the waiter over he had the audacity to say "we ran out of meat for this dish so we used a different cut of meat" . I said are you crazy! If you didn't have the proper meat you should of told me.

Pros:
-BEAUTIFUL decor and ambiance
-Free mimosa or champagne with lunch buffet
-Cheap buffet
-Some dishes were good
-This place offers hookah as well

Cons:
-Very awkward service. Possibly because they're not used to having customers for their lunch buffet (this place was empty)
-Most of the dishes I just didn't care for

This place wasn't very special at all. I'm glad I tried the food, but I probably won't come back.

Loved everything about this place. 
Drinks, food & service. I'm going to be coming back without a doubt !
Came after work with a Co worker.  The staff was super friendly and the food was full of flavor.  Mmmm a new favorite will be coming back again and again.

Worst ever service.  The guy almost had a fight with me for coming at 9 and they close at 10.  Food. Food came out all burned not eatable. Not sure if was done on purpose. Just worst experience ever!!!

After reading all positive review we went there .
Unfortunately it was not a good experience, the meat was too hard not fresh , food was ok . They had 18% tip by default included in our bill and later again asked for tip which was strange to us. Over all not good experience
Food quality needs improvement. Sunday afternoon
Food is AWESOME!!!  The singer though will put you to sleep!!!!!!!! If they bring a Dj, I think they will rock this place!

I am from middle east and I know how the middle eastern food tastes. This restaurant is not as good as the reviews are. Expensive. I went with my wife we had 1 main entree and appetizers with a hookah and paid 100 dollars. Food is below average. Restaurant was empty on a Sunday night. Customer service good. I will not go back to this restaurant since I did not have a good experience.

My experience at this restaurant was horrible. The food tasted bad and didn't come as it was listed on the menu. The roasted chicken was supposed to come with potatoes, but didn't. I can't eat gluten and I made sure when ordering that I wasn't ordering any bread or wheat, yet my order still came out in sandwich form (so special diets stay away). The bill was also a surprise as all prices listed in the menu came out double on the bill. When we tried to correct any of these mistakes the waiter and management simply insisted that everything was correct.

Great cuisine and service. Very authentic but can be enjoyed by anyone. The quality and preparation of the food is excellent. Many delicious options for vegetarians. We've been on various Saturday nights when they have live music and it is a great atmosphere. The staff is very polite and attentive. Highly recommend.
We came here really late on a Thursday night and I must admit the food is really good. Great hummus, clean and the customer service is a plus. The manger is really nice he was very helpful.

Came here to enjoy the music, food, and (Argeela) Hookah this last Saturday and man was I impressed! Here are more details:-

Visiting Vegas for the weekend and wanted to get away from the strip and enjoy authentic middle eastern atmosphere. We called in advance and reserved a table. 

Our table was ready and we ordered cold mezza ( appetizers) and a few cocktails. Haven't had a Lebanese Almaza beer (lager) in a while so I ordered that. My friend ordered Arak, and of course we wanted to smoke some hookah. Prices were very reasonable for food and cocktails.

Service was prompt, and the host/owner Hussam was on it. People started flocking in around 10:30 and the first singer appeared. He sang tradition Lebanese & popular Arabic songs. Followed by a belly dancer  that danced mainly in the dance floor area then moved between tables and was showered with tips. Then a second male singer came to the stage and sang upbeat songs from Arab countries, Armenia, and Turkey. 

In summary, excellent service, tasty food, friendly atmosphere, and good entertainment. Highly recommend this place for authentic Arab food and entertainment!

I am a great fan of Middle Eastern cuisine. I am fortunate to be able to travel to the Middle East yearly and eagerly seek out Middle Eastern restaurants when I come to a new city. I was very disappointed with the food at Ali Baba. Overcooked meats, yes I know Arabs like their meat well done, but I ordered rare hoping for medium rare. No such luck. Gamey lamb, tasteless entrees. The worst backlawa ever, washed down by the worst coffee ever. How can backlawa be this bad? Service is friendly, courteous and professional. Shisha is served table side, so know that as you are eating there is the possibility that those around you may be smoking. I'm cool with it, but the initiated may be surprised. The Shisha is regularly attended to by staff members circling the room. This place really comes alive weekend nights. There is live music with popular Arabic songs performed. There is a dance floor and many of the mature diners dance into the wee hours of the morning. Overall this place is about the Arabic experience, and they do a good job. It's just unfortunate the food is so bad.
Best place to get happy with ur friends and family in the Las Vegas .Live music and belly dancer shows . Music , hookah and food !!!!

This place is a joke and the CLOWN they call the manager should be fired and the place shut down ! 

 Came here with family we weren't sure already about the place but it was recommended on Zabihah, so hesitantly  we decided to give it a try Boy was that a mistake! If I could give this place  NEGATIVE 5 stars I would have.
 We ordered our food with the recommendation of the waiter who was nice and friendly, everyones food came out and mines came 10 minutes later. The Hummas is WHACK  first off its like 80 % tahini our bread was BURNED  but they  still served it  to us. We came right at 5 and the restraunt was DEAD  empty, then suddenly two musicians showed up and started to play and practice off beat music, at a loud annoying volume when we were the only paying customer in the entire restraunt. The two weekend performers acted like they owned the place and abused  it like it was their personal studio. We asked him to stop for 10 minutes  so we can have and finish our meal in peace , instead he turned around and asked for another five minutes of torture because he was practiccing a song he planned  to record.  We waited 5 minutes which became 15 and he increased the volume the horrid amature hour  continued. It was so loud and obnoxious I had to leave the restraunt for air leaving my meal entirely untouched. The manager who was a brick of walking stupidity came and pretended to offer hollow customer service he told us the  the performers  don't speak English ( even though we told them in Arabic.)

The  lazy disgusting excuse for a  Managmer provided every excuse except customer service. We left our meals and didn't not take  anything. The bill was 120 for 4 people the scum manager then offered to give a free meal for 2 people only the next time we come, but there's 4 of us and we would never come back  to this  shotty excuse for Lebanese cuisine.

We discovered this place while looking for a spot to eat before the movie, it's located in the same parking lot as the movie theater on Eastern/215, and nothing else was open at this late hour. We were pleasantly surprised, food was very tasty and service was great. Our waiter (Michael) was very professional and knowledgable, we let them know we were in a rush to make the movie - and he made sure we did. We ordered 2 glasses of wine and 2 entrees, both came with a choice of soup or salad and home made lavash bread. Bill came to $44 with tax, which is very reasonable.

A few weeks ago my girlfriend wanted to come here for lunch as we saw it a few days before on our way to another restaurant. I was pretty excited about it as I hadn't had Lebanese food in years. 

I was introduced to Lebanese cuisine by my Persian girlfriend back in 2005 when it was all the rage on 2nd St in Long Beach, CA. I remember that every time my husband would visit them on a monthly basis, this was a must. This in no way makes me an expert on Lebanese food, so my review is based on customer service we received and the flavor of the food and not on its authenticity. 

Just straight up slow slow service. So slow that they gave us free hummus and pita while we waited as they fried our French fries. 

I love hummus so I'm not sure what was wrong with there's. I can't even explain the taste. I thought at first, maybe we needed to stir it a little to bring out the flavor but it never got better. 

I ordered a chicken pita sandwich and even that was just blah. The only thing I enjoyed was the French fries.

And then back to, the service, just so slow. and because this was my work lunch hour, we were almost late back to the office. In order for us to get back to the office on time, I had to get up, go by the kitchen door and yell "EXCUSE ME!" because I wasn't getting any response with my delicate plea for help.

I'm hoping that this is one of those off days. But unfortunately, this was my first impression and this just wasn't a good one.  I see all the great reviews regarding this restaurant and I'm sure it is honest. So I guess the problem is inconsistency. I think once you have that all worked out, there will be less unfavorable reviews like this one.

Wish you all the best.

I love this place. My friends and I eat, party and celebrate here all the time. I love the live music and the  staff. I'm especially fond of GEORGE who just makes the experience sooooooo much better. He's amazing. Always on point, remembers where i wanna sit, eat and drink. The hookah of course is great too. We'll be back again soon.

This is the worst middle eastern restaurant in town ! 
Ordered beef and chicken kabab , beef tasted so old,chicken was undercooked  ,their salad was soaked with dressing . One word DISGUSTING !!!
Couldn't eat any of my food after the first bite .
Don't waste your money ! 
Never coming back

So, I used to go pick up hummos and tabbouleh at the Mediterranean grocery that was across the parking lot from Ali Baba.  Stopped by on Monday to find out it was CLOSED!!!  So sad!!

So, in a pinch, I ran over to Ali Baba.  I can't tell you how disappointed I was.  The hummos was thick, gluey and bland and the grape leaves were too vinegary.  Rating is up to two stars only because the tabbouleh was very fresh and pretty good, but, I mean, how do you screw up tabbouleh?

George was our server today and he was prompt funny and kind. He made great suggestions on the menu. Also, we were on a strict timeline and he really made our dinner happen a little quicker. The food was so delicious. We will be back again. :) :)

Well, it appears that many are trying to get into the business of Middle Eastern food, & I have to say that here it's pretty good.  They focus on Lebanese style foods & offer pretty good wines... not too extensive... but I see it growing.  The hookah is just o.k. & pricey!  The live music / singer & band help to make up for the so-so hookah... ;)  Overall, it's a nice place to go & kick back & get together with friends to enjoy a Red Wine! & of course, listen to some music... By the way, they offer a great Lunch Buffet...

Had a good two meals here but it went down hill. I used to get take out but now the quality isn't so good. My steak kabobs are way over cooked and dry. Tasteless to say the least. They used to be mefium rare like I asked for. Roasted vegies are barely cooked with the tomato cold and uncooked. Humus was cold and unappealing.  It seems as though the cooks just don't care anymore. I've tried coming back a few more times because i understand that sometimes staff drops the ball. I feel now that this is just their new standard. I don't like writing one or two star reviews. I like to give local businesses a few trys before I make a negative judgement especially restaurants.

Amazing place. 
I'll keep it short.
Food is excellent. Service is excellent. Live entertainment is great.

The cuisine at Ali Baba's is sensational.  Big portions, everything is fresh and tasty.  The wine lists are fantastic and the atmosphere...fantastic.  I never felt like I was in a standard restaurant, all involved from the owners to the servers make sure that you feel like family and bend over backwards to please you.  The foods are served in a timely manner, nice and warm and the veggies....WOW!  Would I go back?  Absolutely!  Do I recommend?  Highly!!  You are missing out on a wonderful experience in all ways.  Go go go!!!  :-)

While I can't attest to the lunch buffet everyone has spoke about in previous reviews, I can attest I had a fantastic dinner here. Started out with Mezza (translates to appetizer in Arabic) which includes; hommos, tabbouleh, baba ghanouj, labneh, falafel and grape leaves. I'm very picky about grape leaves and falafel these were probably some of the best I've had, along with the baba ghanouj. This was huge and I could have easily just eaten this without ordering an entree. This could be split 4 ways, they also offer Grand Mezza, which is twice the amount of food. Only place in town to get Kebbeh Nayah, which is a definite if you come. 

A good accompaniment is Arak, it is to Lebanon as Ouzo is to Greece. It is 100 proof, delicious and I prefer over Ouzo or Sambucca. The way to drink it is over ice mixed with flat water. It is very smooth. 

For my entree I went with the seafood kabab, included a full salmon fillet and marinated shrimp. This was delicious. My date ordered the lamb shank which is supposed to be a house specialty (I'm not a fan of shank anything, so this was not my fav), but he gave it two thumbs up. Lots if Arabic desserts, try the Kanefeh, Maamoud and Lebanese Ice Cream. 

This place gets busy on the weekends around 10pm, they have live music (Arabic) and the belly dancers start at midnight. The atmosphere was good, large room, painted murals, comfy couches to sit and enjoy a hookah.

We were there over the weekend.  Great food.  The hummus was excellent, as was the roasted chichken (with fries no less) and chicken kaboobs.  By accident perhaps, there was a small shaker of seasonings and sesame seeds.  Put this on the hummus.  Wonderful!!

This place charged us $900 for a couple appetizers and some nasty barbecue.. I wouldn't recommend anybody to come here.. food was nasty... STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE... It's probably ran by Turkish terrorists.. they came to America to terrorize our restaurant bills
By far the best place in town for Kebbah and lebnah. George is great. Everything I have had here has been amazing. Check it out, you will not be disappointed!!

For those reviewing this restaurant and saying this is like a Lebanese mother cooking for you, I want to extend my deepest apologies for your mother's cooking. ;) But on a more serious note...

The service was some of the worst I have encountered, even if the manager was nice about it (he served us because I guess he doesn't have enough clientele to warrant hiring anyone else... but doesn't that mean he needs to change something up?)

The hummus was okay. I was disappointed to have paid so much for it and the pita bread was ...well, I can get better at Trader Joe's. For that matter, save your money and grab hummus and pitas at Trader Joe's.

Don't do the shawarma. Don't. Seriously. I moved far away from my beloved Mediterranean favorite restaurant and now I cannot find anything to replace it with. My 50.00 bill from Ali Baba was a kick in the stomach, or was it the Shawarma that was a kick in the stomach?

To add insult to injury, I was late for a movie because it took 40 minutes to get a check from the manager while he was hanging out in the kitchen. Really? 40 minutes without checking on a table? You would be fired for that at my work.
Excellent Lebanese meal! The flavors of the meat were amazing. The rice, stuffed grape leaves, yogurt sauce, wine...so fresh and all made for a wonderful experience. Great service!
Don't bother. Food was served cold & had to be sent back. Hummas made me sick and the Riesling was questionable. Seriously, don't eat here. Parsley or Yanni's would be better choices.

3 1/2 stars. Stumbled upon Ali Baba Cuisine by mistake when I made a wrong turn into this strip center. It was lunch and there was only one other patron besides myself.

My waitress was super friendly and I chose the beef shawarma sammie - combo of lamb, beef seasoned marinated and served with tarator sauce, garlic, lemon juice, seasoned onions, tomatoes and pickles. The sammie was served with fries for $10.00 The sammie was decent although my wrap was  soggy due to the excess sauces.

At night I can imagine this place could be fun with live music, hookah and a dance large dance floor.

Bad customer service, food tasted bad, could it be because of this see the picture and judge by yourselves 

By the way I ordered for take out and didn't realized until I got home ... I can also tell you the place is dirty. Still wanted to give it a try I was really hungry and had been wanting to try for a while .
I came to try the hummus and pita one day for lunch. It was okay. I've had better. Next time I'll try the Greek salad. The cook was really nice.

Went to Ali Baba last night and that visit will most likely be my last.  The food was great, some of the best I've found in Las Vegas.  The service, on the other hand, was bad enough to offset the good food and make me want to never come back.

When I entered the restaurant I stood at the front for five minutes while the owner/manager did 'other things' and didn't even greet me.  Finally I said "two please" and he very slowly grabbed two menus and found a table for me.  The huge restaurant only had two tables occupied, but it still seemed like the host/manager/owner was having difficulty finding a table for me.  

As far as food, i ordered a tabbouleh salad, kibbeh nayeh, and chicken shawarma dinner.  I have no complaints about the food, it was quite good in fact.

When we finished eating it took one hour from the time we told the waiter we were "all set" to get the check and process our payment.  Other than my table, there was only one other table occupied in the entire restaurant at this time, so its not like they were overwhelmed with business.  Overall very strange service, as neither of the two employees that I saw in the restaurant seemed to enthused to satisfy their customers.

Again...food was good...service was terrible.  I will not be returning to Ali Baba.
I love baba ghanoush and this is the best I've ever had.  The lentil soup is to die for as well everything is delicious highly recommended.

I took my mom out to lunch & she wanted to try this place. I had a falafel sandwich & she had the beef shwarma sandwich. The food was very well prepared. The hostess & server (manager) were both friendly & courteous.  My only complaint is the service was pretty slow and we 
were the only people in the restaurant.
we been there coupe time singer musta is best but service and food bad they dont know what they doing they close anytime they want which is worse feeling ever stay away ....

Very good roasted chicken and hummus. The Cadillac margarita is very tasty. 

When Rob is working the staff is very friendly. If he is not there the staff can be very stand off ish and tend to rush you away. 

The hookah is very good the "blue Mist " is the best.

Give me all the Mediterranean food! I'm on a serious Mediterranean kick and I am on a mission to try every place that is a reasonable distance from my home or work. This particular restaurant caught attention since they serving Lebanese food and I can't think of another place doing that in town.

I decided to call in a takeout order on a weeknight to pick up on my way home from work. The man taking my order asked how long until I'd like to pick it up. I said 15 minutes and he said it'd be ready. It was waiting by the door when I arrived 15 minutes later. 

The Kafta Kabob entrée came with two kabobs and white rice. The kafta was nicely seasoned and not greasy. The rice was flavorful with nice seasonings and some almonds for additional flavor. I like that they included onions, a grilled tomato, and a grilled jalapeno with the meat and rice. 

The Mini Mezza Appetizer (for one person) was a real standout. Everything that comes with this was incredibly delicious. It's also a ton of food and I would not describe the portion as "for one" as the menu says. I wouldn't not miss on this if dining in a group. The hommos is creamy, baba ghanouj is smoky, and lebnah is thick and tasty. The tabbouleh was fresh with the perfect amount of dressing. The falafel was spicy and the grape leaves were very good with a hint of lemon. There was plenty of pita bread to help scoop up all of the delicious hommos, baba ghanouj, and lebnah. 

I loved the food and I can't wait to come back with friends and enjoy even more of the menu family style. After trying multiple items here I'll never be able to come in and choose just one item!

Authentic Lebanese Cuisine. 
I think the interior is pretty nice and the ambiance is great.
They  have ethnic music videos and it is quite entertaining. 

The food was great. 
I don't know of a restaurant like it in Las Vegas, so if you are looking for something different, come here! 

Their fresh vegetable salads are very good and different. The soup is very tasty! I am a huge fan!
It is definitely comfort food and if you are not used to ethic food then it is possible you may not be become super fan, but I would say if you are an adventurist foodie, like I am, you will really enjoy coming here!

For authentic Middle Eastern cuisine, it's as good as you could want in Las Vegas. The food is terrific. Have been many times & ordered many things. It's truly Lebonese cuisine as I've requested Syrian dishes not listed on the menu & was told that's their speciality. The symbosik, tabouli, kanafi, kibe naye, baklava, lentil soup...I could go on & on. It's well worth going. Highly recommended.

This is our second time at Ali Baba; the ambiance was sensational!  The entertainment component was great.  They had a live belly dancing show coupled with great Arabic singers who sang variety of Middle Eastern style songs.  

Moreover, the meza appetizer plates were very tasty.  The beef kabob was a filet meat...Very tender and marinated with great spices.  In addition, the service was exceptional.  We were pampered at Ali Baba.  I highly recommend the place without reservation.

Here's the real skinny on Ali Baba - either you're going to hate it or love it. There's probably not much in between.

As for me, my husband and I attended a friend's birthday party here on a Saturday night. As other reviews have mentioned this place gets poppin' on the weekends. My husband and I arrived as the first of the anyone in the party to get there. We were seated at one of the many long tables. That's a thing with Ali Baba, it does seem as though they tend to serve large groups, not small dining parties. I wonder if this is because of a tradition in Lebanese culture? I'm not sure.

Anyway, the place is dimly lit, with a disco ball spinning in one corner above the dance floor and musician's stage. There is a bar area toward the back. The whole of the restaurant is painted with Middle Eastern type scenes. 

On Saturday night they have a band and a singer (yes, a real singer) who sings VERY loudly and everyone cheers and claps and some people sing along. Well, the only way you can sing along is if you know what language he is singing in! People get up and dance all through the night and through their dinners. The singer roams the dining area enticing people to sing and clap with him. it's like a Mexican place that has a band/singers, but taken to the next level. 

By the way, they do hookah here directly on the tables while food is being served. So, if that ain't in your ball park, go elsewhere or it's going to seriously ruin your dining experience if others in the restaurant are partaking of the option, which our party was. I thought it was deliciously naughty and fun to be able to smoke, eat, and drink all at the same time. ;)

As for the food and drinks, and this is honestly one of only two dings I had regarding our experience here. I find the pricing to be a little much. My husband ordered a Jack and Coke and it cost him $10 (plus tip). I mean yikes. That's crazy. Plus, the food is NOT cheap. You can get food such as this elsewhere at lower prices. 

What we had food-wise was appetizer plates split between our entire group. We got two orders of their Grand Mezza (which was actually too much for 10 people). It came with: Hommos, Tabbouleh, Baba Ghanouj, Labneh, Falafel, Kebbehballs, Mixed Pies (Cheese, Spinach, Meat), Fool Medamas, Sujok, Bastermaand Grape Leaves. I honestly cannot at this point in time remember what I actually ate, although I tried to get a bit of everything. I thought everything had great flavor and was tasty. The only thing I did not like was the Bastermaand Grape Leaves. Too much of a bitter flavor. I think I would have to go back and really sit down and know what I was eating to really give a good review on the food. But overall, for our party these dishes worked well.

We also ordered two bottles of Arak for the table. This is the national alcoholic drink of Lebanon and it is 100 proof liquor and it is not cheap. We all imbibed and we were all very merry. We danced and clapped and ate and smoked and danced some more and ate and drank some more.

Honestly I loved partying here! I thought it was fun. The only issue I had was that it was just a tad too loud to hear much of what my party was saying. 

Besides the loudness and the high-prices Ali Baba was an awesome time. I would defintiely recomend if you are lookiing for something a bit different for a large group party.

BIT BY SCORPION THAT DROPPED FROM CEILING DURING DINNER:  On October 28, 2013 my husband and myself along with six other couples went to eat at Ali Baba.  We are fairly regular customers there and have always enjoyed the food, service, etc.  (Even though there is hardly ever anyone in there and there are far too many tables jammed into their space).  We were enjoying our dinner and were just winding things up when a scorpion fell from the ceiling and bit my husband twice..once on the neck and once on his chest.  It caused much alarm and distress among our table, needless to say.  The waiter was alerted to what had just taken place and with absolutely no sense of urgency whatsoever wanders back into the kitchen and comes back several minutes later with a mumbled apology and says they will, 'take $25 off our tab'...which, by the way, was well over $300!  My husband was very sick for several days after because of this and we are still considering legal action!  STAY AWAY...it was a baby scorpion that dropped from the ceiling where there was a small hole!  I'm fairly certain that was not the only one up there!!!  I'm not sure which was more distressing:  My husband getting bit by a scorpion in this restaurant or their COMPLETE and utter lack of concern for what had just happened!!

AMAZING. We love the filet and hummus. It is top notch. To my surprise they now make homemade fresh hot pita bread. It was great before but now it is even better. The service is always good, but the service today with Monica was beyond words. Great experience.

An extra star for the decor.  The place is beautiful!  It was a Tuesday night and I met a friend for dinner.  She's half-Lebanese and this was her turf, food and location-wise.  She wanted grape leaves; I don't like them, so we settled on hummus and spinach pie for appetizers.  The hummus was okay, the spinach pie less so - four or five phyllo triangles stuffed with a dry spinach mixture.

For the main course we ordered "Tasty Salmon", which is supposed to be "char-grilled fresh salmon with rosemary and lemon juice served with a special spinach sauce".  There was no char, I didn't taste any rosemary and lemon juice, and the special spinach sauce was an orange-colored cream sauce with a few flecks of spinach.  The menu had no mention of cream in this sauce.  Cream and I have a love-hate relationship.  Overall, it tasted okay, but nothing special.  The salmon was a smallish portion, but it came with a huge mound of rice pilaf, and vegetables just this side of the freezer.

Service was very friendly and good at the beginning, but later on, when the big space was crowded with just two more tables (!), it was somewhat hard to get the waiter's attention.

My friend said that the beautiful patio fronting the restaurant is new.  Unfortunately, it was brutally hot and even steamy, so there was no way we were going to sit outside.  But since this restaurant is way on the other side of town, I'm unlikely to savor that patio. There are too many better, closer restaurants.  It's a shame, because decor like that deserves food worthy of its surroundings.

I come to Ali Baba almost every week. The food is amazing. The place is really enjoyable on the weekend with the love band and belly dancer,but it's open 7 days a week and food is great anytime. The service is outstanding and very friendly.

We showed up for dinner around 6pm on a Wednesday night and we were the only people in the restaurant. I usually would turn around and leave anywhere else, but there are not that many Lebanese restaurants in Vegas, so I decided to give it a go.

Apps:
It was happy hour between 4 and 7, so most of the apps were 1/2 off. We ordered fattoush, tabouli, hummus, baba ganoush, meat grape leaves, and veggie grape leaves.  Everything was pretty good except the tabouli had too much dressing and could have been mixed with some more bulgar wheat. The fattoush was pretty good and it had enough sumac in it too. Some people don't put enough sumac in their fattoush.

Iced Tea - I think they put rose water in their tea. It was pretty good.

Entrees:
 Chicken shawarma plate. It came with hummus and real Lebanese style garlic sauce. The chicken was not cooked on the proper vertical rotisserie, but it was spiced properly and it tasted very good.

Lamb Kabob - my daughter ordered it well done, so she basically ruined the meat, so I didn't bother to try it. It was a nice presentation though with the rice and veggies.

Falafel plate - they were good. Served with the traditional tahini sauce.

The service was great. It should be, we were the only customers there. The dining room decor reminded me of the Arabic restaurants back home in Dearborn from the 80's. I liked it. Some might find it a bit dated though. I don't know why it was not busy, but I recommend you stop by and try some Lebanese cuisine. I think you will enjoy Ali BaBa's.
This is a great place. The food is excellent and the atmosphere is wonderful. The live entertainment and belly dancers and hookah are fantastic. It's a great experience.

let me fill everyone in on a little known fact about this place. I am middle eastern so I think i know a little more and my review will probably be helpful. When going to Ali Baba you HAVE to go for the buffet only, it is $20 its good food although its a little pricey for a brunch buffet. When eating dinner here its hit or miss. Ive never had a bad experience with the buffet, its good food even though there isn't much variety, but of all the middle eastern places in Vegas this is the best. The dinner on the other hand is not the same. I have had dinner and it was bad. The food is over priced, the hookah is not. Beer and alcohol is also over priced.

worse place ever. its the worst service i have ever seen in my life. Bad hookah and the worst service ever i asked for water i got it after 3 hrs. They gave me water from an open bottle . I was shocked i have no nothing else to say

Give the best 5 stars,  when someone earns it .
Ali Baba is a great place to dine and enjoy the true flavor of Arabia.  Food tasted amazing no matter what you order.  I got the Largest Mazza Combo,  Falafel,  Kuba, Tabuleh, Hummus, Baba Ghanug, pastirma, Labni,Foul,Grape leaves, Armenian Sausages and Arabic Bread. 
We couldn't finish the food although it's the best we tasted so far . I wish we have a branch in Fresno.  Ali Baba also had Hookahs and live music on weekends,  too bad we missed it . But we will be back for sure,  very soon. Thanks to Waseem our evening was magnificent dining experience.

I took my wife on a weekday around 8:30 pm. The second I walked through the door I was greeted with, "hello I just want to let you know we close in an hour and a half". Sat down and the AC was down. Didn't feel like ordering anything, so I ordered desert only with coffee... Came out to ~30$......it is very pricey here and from my experience the service wasn't anything special. Probably will not come again
The night life here is a amazing. The food is always delicious and the hookah is pretty good too. You must call to reserve a table on weekends because it can get really busy.

great service and the BEST KEBABS I've ever had! especially the lamb and steak kebab, I don't know how they do it, but it's so tender it almost melts in your mouth. They have a live band bellydancing on the weekends but I've never gone on a weekend, so I can't rate the quality of entertainment.

Traveling back from Amman and Beirut, I thought I had my fill of Lebanese food, but when I got home, it was calling me.  I went to Ali Baba and with my family and have enjoyed it overall.

Not the same as back in the ME, but the staff are nice, if you go early, you are the only ones and get good service. 

The quail is good, the falafel is good as well. The baba ghanoush is very tasty and the sausages are excellent. Nice place to go with friends and family.

Went here just before heading back to the airport, we were concerned because of the reviews, we had a big group, six people, we were the only ones in the place. The food was really good, the ambience is unimpressive, and the service was very slow. Don't go here if you are in a rush, but if you're not, the food is worth a visit.

So since i moved to vegas and always looking for a great Lebanese spot this place was great. I have been there twice. Portions are big and the prices are reasonable. They have the Kebbeh Neyyeh wich is always one of my favs. The only reason i didn't give it 5 stars is because the service was really slow at the end of the night.

Terrible, we made a reservation and then came early and they had us walk from table to table saying no, not this table, then they sat us at someone's table, that person showed up and told us to get out. Took about 20m to seat us. What a disorganized place with terrible service.
Very good Lebanese/Jordanian food! Outstanding service and great kunefe! Definitely worth checking out!

Bad service!

I have to say if it wasn't for the music & singers (on weekends only) I would never go there to eat or drink anything. Since they have this automatic tip policy, the servers/staff could care less if they give you any "service" whatsoever. Went there for dinner & drinks and this one new server had me waiting almost an hour for a drink! After asking her several times "where's my drink" she finally comes over and instead of getting close to the table to set my drink down, she grabs it from her tray (far from table) and spills it all over me! she doesn't even apologize, and was like "oops", then walks off. I was appalled at this situation. Any other reputable establishment would have comped off my entire dinner or at least all my drinks. Not this place, they didn't even bother, they only took off 1 drink (which is the one she spilled on me & I did not drank). This place is horrible.

Visited this place because of the restuarant.com coupon my brother had. 

I printed one myself not knowing we already had one for our group. Needless to say I still have my coupon. Dont really want to go again even with a 25 dollar gift certificate. 

The food is ok at best, I found stuff half the price and way better in flavor, texture and quality. 

The shwarna didnt tatse like it came from the tradition spit, I could of fried my own beef/lamb at home way better. 

The chicken was moist but bland. 

Damn I miss Zankou chicken..

Mediterranean buffet? Yes, please. This $15 culinary treat happens only on the weekends, and I stopped in on a Sunday. I was surprised to find the restaurant pretty empty, but that never stopped me from noshing on hummus!

The buffet offers approximately 8 hot dishes and 4 cold dishes, which I thought was a generous offering. The hot dishes included beef and chicken options. I was surprised to not find too many vegetarian entrees, as even the eggplant and grape leaves had beef. In terms of the flavor, I thought the hot options were good, but perhaps a little oily. The chicken dishes were tender, and the beef was all nicely seasoned. However, I only had one plate of the hot goods. 

For the cold dishes, there was hummus, tabouleh, baba ganoush, and romaine salad. I thought all of these were above average, so I filled up a second plate with these. Sadly, the pita (my preferred serving utensil for hummus and baba ganoush) was not homemade or warmed properly. It became hard quickly. 

When I was there, I think they forgot to turn on the music, so there was an awkward ambiance. You wanted to whisper! Service was rather nonchalant. 

If it were several dollars cheaper, it may earn a fourth star, but the price to tastiness ratio isn't quite there, and the pita bread was a real disappointment. Still, for a weekend gathering of pals, it is still a good option!

I came here three years ago and had the worst service of my life. Today I came back to give it one last chance because my friend can only eat halal. Not only way the food way better but my server Monica was the most amazing server I've had in years. I am a bartender and I know what to expect and what good service is. She was beyond amazing. I would recommend all of my friends to go just because of her. If they lose her they're in trouble. Thank you so much Monica for being amazing!!

Well for starters if I could give them zero stars I would. I have gone to many middle eastern restaurants and had great experiences. So I had very high hopes for this restaurant but I was extremely let down. I have middle eastern background so I thought this would be one of my best experience since I know how everything is. So it turns out that I was wrong and extremely disappointed. When we first walked in the door we automatically felt unwelcomed. We didn't think much of it and sat down to enjoy our night. So as the night went on, the owner/manager didn't even care  to ask us how our experience was but he went to ask the other tables constantly. Then came the music, I had talked to the singer and he was more then happy when I requested Armenian music. I thought everyone would enjoy it and dance along, since we were enjoying there's, but I was wrong. Looks like my music was also unpleasant. I will not recommend this restaurant especially to my Armenian community. The only positive experience from this place was our server. I over all felt unwelcomed and am disappointed at the money we spent there. Thank you I will never be back no matter what.

The Maza platter is very good here. One of the best   Baba ganoush I have ever had . I had the chicken kabob and the chicken was perfectly flavored. Husband had the lentil soup and I had a taste, it was very good! They used to have the best rice pudding but the last few times it was made completely different than what it used to be. Much be a new cook. We love this place and go here once a month, highly recommend it if you're patient. The service is a bit slow as they're more of a relaxed nature. They are very nice though if you get to know them.

I don't think I have to go back.  Food was slightly below average and the place was kind of dirty.  There was still food from whomever ate at the table last all over the floor like the place needed to be vacuumed.  Since we went for lunch my guess is it was there from the night before. 

I'd skip this place
I haven't tried everything on the menu because I am such a fan of the mazza and grand mezza platters!  So much good food in generous portions for a very reasonable price.

I was there for dinner. It was almost empty on the weekday night I went. Food was good particularly the salad. Service was attentive though only one waiter. Nice environment. Located in a mall, difficult to find. Prices reasonable. Good place for Arabic food.

The food was delicious and the atmosphere was quite pleasant. My only complaint was that our server was hovering while we're deciding on what to order (asking every 30 seconds or so kind of hovering) and then was nowhere to be found from the time we got our food till we finally flagged him down for the checks.

My experience with the server is not enough to keep me from going back though

I really love the food in this place. The mezze combination is enough to feed 4 people easily, and it's delicious. They have the standard stuff like hummous, babaganoush, and lebni, but there are most interesting treats, like kibbe, and a mindblowing bean concoction which is intensely garlicky and the beans are so buttery they melt in your mouth, they also serve up some pastries similar to mini spanakopitas as well as chunks of feta, olives and some fresh jalapeos, I could go on, there are thing's I've forgotten to mention, I'm sure. We've also had some of their entrees and sandwiches, all of them were excellent. Definitely seek this place out. 

One word of warning, they have live music on Saturday's and Fridays and it's wacky Mediterranean music with a belly dancer that walks around all the tables, nothing wrong with that, except it's a bit too loud and I like to be able to sustain a conversation over dinner.

I hate to be the one to give the sucky review but that's just what my experience here was. Rude service m, shawarma was way too salty and full of garlic... Just horrible all around. On top of everything my fork was dirty and had to ask for another one.

I regret to say that our dinner experience was quite terrible here. Our food was bad- the spinach pie was off and the soup was rancid. 

The service was slow. We were left at our table waiting for 30 minutes waiting for a check after we declined dessert. 

Not many vegetarian options.

Our first time here. The food was great, but the service was excellent! Monica was very helpful
and attentive. We got there in time to take advantage of the lunch specials. We tried the chicken shawarma sandwich, the beef shawarma sandwich, the kofta kabab sandwich and the falafel appetizer. All were tasty and very reasonably priced. I believe the quality of the service is equally as important as the quality of the food. I would definitely come back here.
Great customer service , I definitely Will come back. George & staff were great. Food is excellent.

While Ali Baba no longer offers the weekend AYCE buffet as I previously reviewed a few years back, I still dine here frequently with my family. 

Our "go to" dishes are the beef shawarma plate, tabouli, chicken kabobs and their hot & fresh pita bread. The "Mom" is always there slaving away in the kitchen. She as well as the servers always have a smile on their face and "Mom" will make a point to greet our table. She always makes my daughter a shirley temple (extra cherries) and gives her extra bread to make her happy.

Fantastic customer service and great quality food!!

Food was ok, nothing great.  Had a hard time trying to flag down the server even after they took my card to charge it.  Gratuity is included (18%) in your bill when they take your card, then they bring you back the un-itemized slip which has a section for "Tip", on top of the 18% they already took.  I understand servers make their income on tips so I tend to tip well but don't try to screw me either.

Won't be going back.

Wonderful food, great service.  I had had a lot hummus before I went to Ali Baba, but I never really understood how wonderful it could be until Ali Baba.  Also, the Belly Dancer is the hotness.  Kinda felt like I got a lap dance from her, which is nice with dinner.

Wow! This lebanese restaurant in Las Vegas is a Must! It is very Authentic. The food there is like a Lebanese Mom has cooked it for you.
When you go there, make sure you arrive between 11-2:30pm because they have an Open Buffet. OMG, it is a King's fiest! Every single thing you taste there is amazing: The chicken and Lamb Kabob, the Stuffed Eggplant, Zuccini & Cabbage, The Chicken Rice, The Mloukhiyeh! If you're planning to go to Vegas with some friends and you'd like to try something different than the regular buffet that you find on the Strip, then this is the place to try. You won't regret it ;) Enjoy!
